title: Asia Cup: Drama in Dubai- Inside details of how PCB chief Naqvi ran away with trophy
content: India’s Asia Cup 2025 victory over Pakistan turned chaotic off the field, with PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi reportedly taking the trophy and medals after the Indian team refused to receive them from him. The Indian players celebrated with an imaginary trophy, while Suryakumar Yadav and Abhishek Sharma publicly criticised the ACC in the post-match press conference.

title: India's strained ties with US won't hit our relations: Russia
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov affirmed the India-Russia economic partnership remains strong, despite India-US tensions. He praised India's "self-respect" and independent foreign policy in securing its energy interests, particularly regarding Russian oil imports. Lavrov highlighted Russia's full respect for India's national interests and confirmed President Putin's December visit for the annual summit.

title: Making of tragedy: Vijay's late entry, roadshow & payday rush
content: A deadly stampede at a TVK rally in Karur claimed 40 lives, largely due to president Vijay's delayed arrival, which swelled the crowd far beyond the venue's capacity. Congestion worsened as his vehicle moved through the packed area, and darkness from a power disruption triggered chaos, leading to the tragic crush.

title: BCCI sends strong warning to PCB after Asia Cup 2025 trophy drama in Dubai
content: India's Asia Cup triumph over Pakistan was overshadowed by unprecedented drama as ACC president Mohsin Naqvi allegedly walked away with the winners' trophy. BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia confirmed India refused to accept the silverware from him, announcing a ₹21 crore cash reward for the team and vowing a strong protest at the upcoming ICC conference.

title: Michigan church shooting: 4 killed, several injured as gunman opens fire on worshippers
content: A Michigan church service turned horrific when a gunman crashed his truck, opened fire, and set the building ablaze, killing two and injuring eight. Police shot dead the attacker, Thomas Jacob Sanford, a 40-year-old former US Marine. The 10-minute rampage left the church destroyed, with authorities investigating the motive behind this shocking act of violence.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump's order
content: President Trump's significant H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a stir, prompting Canada to consider attracting highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts view this as a "wonderful opportunity" to draw talent left stranded by the US policy, despite potential challenges within Canada's immigration system.

title: Surya slams ACC for withholding trophy; donates match fees to armed forces
content: India skipper Suryakumar Yadav criticised the Asian Cricket Council for denying his team the Asia Cup 2025 trophy despite a hard-fought triumph over Pakistan in the final. Calling his teammates the “real trophies,” he stressed the significance of the win while dismissing concerns over his form. In a heartfelt gesture, Suryakumar announced he would donate his match fees to the Indian armed forces.

title: Top stocks to buy: What is the Nifty outlook for week starting September 29?
content: Stock market recommendations: Nifty and Bank Nifty experienced significant declines last week, with Nifty falling due to US policy changes impacting IT and pharma sectors, signaling deepening bearish sentiment. Amidst this market weakness, SBI Securities recommends accumulating Larsen & Toubro and Ashok Leyland, citing strong technical breakouts and resilience for both stocks.

title: Mayoral shake-up: NYC mayor Eric Adams ends reelection bid; clears way for three-way race
content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has ended his reelection bid, setting up a three-way race for the city's top office between Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo, and Curtis Sliwa. Adams' withdrawal, announced via video, comes amidst low poll numbers and a corruption scandal, though his name will still appear on the November ballot. This significantly alters the mayoral contest.

title: Accenture CEO on US’ H-1B visa policy: $100K fees non issue; India workforce key
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed concerns about the new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, calling it a "non-issue" for the global consulting giant due to its minimal reliance on such visas. This stance sharply contrasts with Indian IT firms heavily dependent on the program.

title: Chaos in Katy Texas as 3 Muslim men shoot Little League baseball coach during prayer
content: A 27-year-old baseball coach was struck by a stray bullet during a youth tournament in Katy, Texas, on September 21, 2025. The coach, hit in the shoulder, was airlifted and released in stable condition. Three suspects face deadly conduct charges after shots, believed to be from nearby property, injured the coach.

title: Pak captain: 'Suryakumar shook hands privately', slams IND for disrespecting cricket
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha slammed India for disrespecting cricket during the Asia Cup, claiming Suryakumar Yadav shook hands in private but refused to do the same in front of the cameras. He also stated that his side posed for pictures with the trophy as they wanted to fulfill their obligations.

title: H-1B visa fees hike: Startup CEO challenges move; claims it will favour tech firms
content: Box CEO Aaron Levie criticizes President Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it disadvantages startups against big tech companies in the global talent war. He advocates for a lower fee and a broader reform framework, including flexible visa caps and attracting top talent while protecting American wages. Concerns are raised about innovation potentially moving overseas.

title: Cancer cases in India up by 26%, deaths 21% since 1990
content: Cancer incidence in India surged by 26% since 1990, with deaths up 21%, contrasting sharply with declines in the US and China. This rise is attributed to high tobacco use, obesity, and inadequate early detection. Experts advocate for stronger prevention, expanded screening, and increased tobacco taxes to reverse this alarming trend.

title: UAE remains top destination for Indians' outbound travel
content: Indian nationals' departures reached 30.8 million in 2024, with the UAE leading as the top destination, attracting 7.8 million travelers. Leisure and diaspora visits primarily drove this significant increase, supported by higher disposable incomes and improved air connectivity. The 25-44 age group constituted the largest share of travelers, reflecting a robust post-pandemic recovery.

title: Woman diagnosed with aggressive breast cancer, after doctors said it was ‘nothing’
content: A 35-year-old woman, initially dismissed a breast lump, attributing it to hormonal changes. Despite a family history, she was advised against early mammograms. Mammogram is a screening test to detect breast cancer in people with no symptoms and diagnosis to investigate symptoms or abnormalities found during a physical exam. Diagnosed with aggressive breast cancer while pregnant, she bravely underwent treatment to save herself and her baby, emphasizing the danger of ignoring symptoms.

title: Ed Sheeran’s Swift–Kelce comment has fans questioning his bond with her
content: Ed Sheeran's confession that he learned of Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce via Instagram has fueled speculation about a crack in their friendship. Fans are questioning their bond, recalling past instances of perceived disloyalty. Neither has responded, while Swift is reportedly focused on planning her wedding for next summer.

title: Giants rookie Jaxson Dart hit by false Madison Beer rumor before facing Herbert
content: Rookie Giants quarterback Jaxson Dart faces a dramatic NFL debut, embroiled in a viral controversy involving a fake Instagram post linking him to Madison Beer, rumored girlfriend of Chargers QB Justin Herbert. Dart, replacing Russell Wilson, aims to make history by defeating Herbert's undefeated Chargers in his first start, despite the off-field distraction.

title: Taylor Swift leaves Selena Gomez’s wedding early to rejoin Kelce
content: Taylor Swift attended Selena Gomez's wedding in California. She then flew to Kansas City. Swift supported her fiancé Travis Kelce. He had a game against the Baltimore Ravens. This trip showed her commitment to both friends and romance. She left the wedding late Saturday night. Her private jet landed in Missouri with hours to spare.

title: Op Sindoor on games field, outcome is the same: PM as India beats Pak in Asia Cup final
content: India secured a thrilling Asia Cup 2025 triumph over Pakistan, winning by five wickets in Dubai. Prime Minister Modi celebrated the victory with a viral tweet, declaring "#OperationSindoor". Tilak Varma's unbeaten 69 anchored India's chase of 147, while Kuldeep Yadav's 4/30 dismantled Pakistan's batting. This dominant win, marked by intense rivalry, clinched India's record-extending ninth Asia Cup crown.

title: Who is Nigel Max Edge? Suspect identified and charged in North Carolina shooting
content: Nigel Max Edge, 40, faces three murder and five attempted murder charges after opening fire from a boat at a Southport, NC restaurant, killing three and wounding five. The combat veteran, reportedly suffering from PTSD, previously escorted Kellie Pickler to the CMAs and claimed friendly fire in Iraq by "LGBTQ White Supremacists."

title: Man roped in teen son to kill property dealer over 9-yr feud
content: A father-son duo was arrested for the murder of 56-year-old property dealer Lakhpat Singh Kataria in Malviya Nagar, culminating a decade-long vendetta. The 47-year-old father allegedly involved his 17-year-old son, timing the crime a day before his 18th birthday to exploit juvenile laws.

title: EC to deploy 470 officers for Bihar election, bypolls
content: The Election Commission will deploy 470 officers from various civil services as general, police, and expenditure observers for the upcoming Bihar assembly election and bypolls in seven states. These observers will ensure fairness, impartiality, and credibility, acting as the EC's eyes and ears to oversee the electoral process and flag any abuse of money power.

title: Congress writes to home minister over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress general secretary K C Venugopal urged Home Minister Amit Shah for swift action against BJP spokesperson Printu Mahadev over a death threat to Rahul Gandhi. Mahadev allegedly stated, "Rahul Gandhi will be shot in the chest," during a televised debate. Venugopal warned of complicity if no action is taken, citing serious security concerns.

title: Asia Cup: Tilak, Kuldeep help India beat Pakistan, win ninth continental title
content: India clinched the 2025 Asia Cup with a five-wicket win over Pakistan in Dubai on Sunday (September 28). Sahibzada Farhan’s fiery fifty set up Pakistan, but a stunning collapse from 113/1 to 146 all out handed India the edge. Tilak Varma’s gritty 69* and Shivam Dube’s power-hitting ensured India overcame early setbacks to seal another tense India-Pakistan classic.

title: Illegal betting: ED may attach assets of celebs
content: The ED is intensifying its probe into the 1xBet online betting platform, considering property attachments for individuals linked to money laundering. Celebrities, including cricketers and filmstars, who endorsed the illegal platform, may be named as accused in the upcoming chargesheet. Some have appeared for questioning, while others face further summonses, indicating a widening investigation into illegal betting activities.

title: Asia Cup: Rs 21cr bonanza! BCCI rewards Team India after record 9th title
content: India clinched their record-extending ninth Asia Cup title by defeating arch-rivals Pakistan in Dubai, with Tilak Varma's unbeaten 69 anchoring the chase and Kuldeep Yadav's spell triggering a collapse. The BCCI rewarded the champions with a massive Rs 21 crore prize money, celebrating a significant victory ahead of the T20 World Cup.

title: Ivan Demidov shines: Canadiens rookie shows star potential vs Maple Leafs
content: Montreal Canadiens lost a preseason game. Rookie Ivan Demidov delivered an eye-catching performance. He recorded a power-play assist. This performance offers a positive for the team. However, defenseman David Reinbacher will miss four weeks. He suffered a metacarpal fracture. This injury complicates the team's defense. The Canadiens now face a mixed outlook for the upcoming season.

title: Amit Shah rejects Naxals' truce offer, vows menace will end in March
content: Home Minister Amit Shah rejected the CPI(Maoist) ceasefire offer, reaffirming the March 2026 deadline to end armed Naxalism. He stated no ceasefire for security forces, but offered rehabilitation for those who surrender. Shah also criticized civil society elements supporting Maoists, highlighting the Modi government's successful strategy in reducing LWE fatalities.

title: 'Tweets make a difference': Jaishankar's dig at Trump; flags market uncertainty
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted global unpredictability, noting how "tweets" and rapid policy changes impact the world order. He urged de-risking through resilient supply chains and diverse production centres. Jaishankar also subtly criticised major powers like the US and China for trade protectionism and tariff volatility, which erode international trust and disproportionately affect the Global South.

title: Spirit of 'nation first' paramount for RSS volunteers, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his 'Mann Ki Baat', hailed RSS's "unprecedented and inspiring" 100-year journey, emphasizing its dedication to nation-building and service since its 1925 founding. He also highlighted Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti, Bhagwan Ram's inclusive ideals, and the new temples for Nishadraj and Valmiki built alongside the Ram temple in Ayodhya.

title: Immigration gets faster with e-arrival cards from October 1
content: India will streamline foreign national arrivals from October 1 by replacing physical disembarkation cards with optional digital e-arrival cards for work, tourism, study, or business visitors. This initiative, alongside the existing Fast Track Immigration - Trusted Traveller Programme for Indian citizens and OCI holders, aims to significantly reduce immigration delays at airports nationwide.

title: 2 of 4 protesters killed in Ladakh protest cremated
content: Amid curfew and mobile internet ban, two victims of Ladakh's violent statehood protest were cremated under heavy security, with media barred and a local leader prevented from attending. Congress blamed the Centre and BJP for the crisis, accusing them of abandoning Ladakhis after the Article 370 abrogation, while clarifying Sonam Wangchuk's non-affiliation.

title: Zubeen was 'Kohinoor of Assamese culture': PM Modi
content: PM Narendra Modi hailed Zubeen Garg as the "Kohinoor of Assamese culture" during his Mann Ki Baat address, as grief over the music icon's death continued. Modi linked Garg's loss to Bhupen Hazarika's centenary celebrations. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari also cited Garg's life to highlight the supremacy of talent over other privileges.

title: Search operation launched after suspected Pakistan drone spotted in J&K’s Samba
content: A search operation was launched in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district after locals reported a suspected Pakistani drone. This incident highlights the persistent threat of cross-border drone activities, frequently used by terrorist outfits to smuggle weapons and narcotics, aiming to revive terrorism in the region. Security forces regularly recover such illicit drops.

title: Ladakh's people, traditions under attack, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi alleged that Ladakh's people and culture were under attack from the BJP and RSS, demanding the UT's inclusion in the Sixth Schedule. He criticized the government for violence and jailing Sonam Wangchuk, a sentiment echoed by Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, who condemned the Modi government's handling and Wangchuk's arrest under NSA.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Will Cowboys WR play vs Packers tonight?
content: The Dallas Cowboys will face the Green Bay Packers tonight without star wide receiver CeeDee Lamb, who sustained a brutal ankle injury against the Chicago Bears. Lamb is expected to miss three to four weeks, prompting the team to consider George Pickens, Jalen Tolbert, and KaVontae Turpin as replacements. Offensive coordinator Klayton Adams praised Turpin's readiness and leadership qualities.

title: People can witness Chhath divinity if it gets Unesco tag: PM Modi
content: PM Narendra Modi expressed hope for Chhath Puja's UNESCO recognition, envisioning global appreciation for its grandeur and divinity. He linked the festival to economic empowerment, recalling past government support and urging citizens to buy local products. This initiative aims to elevate regional traditions to global platforms and strengthen the grassroots economy.

title: Asia Cup | Watch: Gambhir goes crazy, bangs table during IND vs PAK final
content: India clinched their record ninth Asia Cup title, defeating Pakistan in a thrilling final. Tilak Varma's unbeaten 69 anchored India's chase of 147, culminating in a towering six that sealed the victory. Former opener Gautam Gambhir's passionate table-thumping celebration became an iconic moment, reflecting the intensity of the rivalry.

title: Two infiltrators killed along LoC
content: Security forces foiled an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kupwara on Sunday, killing two infiltrators in the Keran sector after a gunbattle. A search operation is currently underway. This marks the second such incident this month, following an August 31 encounter in the Gurez sector, highlighting these traditional infiltration routes.

title: Venezuela Fury and Noah Price: Teen couple’s combined net worth revealed
content: Tyson Fury's 16-year-old daughter, Venezuela Fury, and young boxer Noah Price are engaged, drawing significant public attention. Venezuela, a social media personality, and Noah, a rising amateur boxer, are both building their careers. Despite their famous family connections, their combined personal net worth is estimated to be under $200,000 as they embark on their shared journey.

title: Rs 355 crore sale marks new high for Indian art market
content: Vasudeo Gaitonde's painting set a new record at Saffronart's 25th anniversary sale, selling for Rs 67.08 crore and making him India's second priciest artist. The auction achieved a record Rs 355.8 crore for South Asian art, showcasing market resilience. Nalini Malani's contemporary work also saw significant success.

title: 'Sublime creation': Idli gets roasted online; enters Shashi Tharoor, the defender
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor passionately defended idli on X, calling it "a cloud, a whisper, a perfect dream" after a critic dismissed it as "steamed regret." He likened enjoying idli to experiencing a Beethoven symphony, celebrating South Indian culinary heritage. His poetic post quickly went viral, garnering widespread praise and shared love for the dish.

title: Is Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson running in the US presidential election? Here’s the truth
content: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson left the door open for a future White House run in a late-September 2025 interview, stating "we'll see." This contrasts with his 2022 declaration that a bid was "off the table" to prioritize family. Public interest remains high, with polls and betting markets reflecting curiosity about his potential candidacy for 2028 or beyond.

title: Analysing Indian States’ macro-fiscal health
content: In the 2010s, States were able to prosper economically through reforms, better tax collection, and booming growth. Some States even reported surpluses. But the pandemic was a turning point — tax revenues shrank while emergency spending soared, pushing almost every State back

title: Spice Route Initiative to string together ancient ports and heritage sites
content: The Muziris Projects Limited has introduced a unique project — the Spice Route Initiative — under which a range of initiatives and programmes have been planned

title: ‘Clog the toilet’ trolls hit Indian visa holders rushing to U.S.
content: Racially motivated far-right trolls launched coordinated efforts to disrupt flight bookings from India after Trump announced the new H-1B visa fee

title: Fire breaks out at Tiruvannamalai GH
content: Based on an alert, a six-member firefighters team and Tiruvannamalai East police personnel rushed to the spot.

title: 92% UGD work completed in Vellore, says Corporation Commissioner
content: Corporation Commissioner R. Lakshmanan told The Hindu that completion of ongoing pipeline-carrying bridge across Palar river, pipe-laying work in at least five streets in Old Town area, and construction of a new pumping station at Vasanthapuram behind the fort complex are remaining works as part of the UGD system.

title: CMC organises cookery competition in Vellore to mark World Diabetes Day
content: Welcoming the gathering, Ms. Agarwal said that the importance of inculcating healthy habits right from childhood is required.

title: Will donate my Asia Cup match fee to Armed Forces and Pahalgam victims: Suryakumar Yadav
content: “I have never seen this before, winning team not receiving trophy,” said Suryakumar Yadav on Indian team not being presented Asia Cup; India defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the final to win the trophy

title: 7-year-old Class 2 student hung upside down by school bus driver in Panipat over ‘misbehaviour’; FIR filed
content: The incident that took place over a month ago came to light when the boy’s mother stumbled upon the video on Instagram on Saturday

title: Tea garden workers protest over bonus; management releases first instalment
content: Workers of Nagaisuri Tea garden held protests on September 26 and 27 and called off their agitation after there was an assurance by the management to provide bonus in three instalments

title: PM Modi meets Vice President Radhakrishnan
content: "Hon'ble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi met with Hon'ble Vice-President Shri C P Radhakrishnan at the Vice-President's Enclave today," the Vice President's secretariat said on X.

title: Government aims to integrate Ayurveda into health education curriculum in schools, colleges: Minister
content: Discussions are underway with NCERT and UGC for preparing course modules for the school education and higher education, says Prataprao Jadhav

title: BCCI to lodge protest against Naqvi after Asia Cup trophy presentation fiasco
content: “We came along with the medals, so it is very unfortunate, very unsporting and we hope that the trophy and the medals will be returned to India as soon as possible”, said Devajit Saikia, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) secretary.

title: Durga Puja revellers flock early to pandals in West Bengal fearing rain
content: Durga Puja festivities will peak over the next four days of Saptami, Ashtami, Navami, and Dashami; large crowds were seen in Kolkata, its suburbs, and in the districts across West Bengal on Sasthi, the sixth day of the festival

title: There is still room for talks with Maoists: Chhattisgarh CM Vishnu Deo Sai
content: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister says the double-engine government has played a significant role in the fight against Maoists in the State; he says tourism is a focus area in Bastar because of its natural beauty, and agriculture and dairy will be promoted because tribal communities have a particular interest in farming; the State has received investment proposals worth ₹7 lakh crore in just 10 months, he adds

title: Asia Cup trophy not awarded to champions India after they refuse to accept it from ACC chief Mohsin Naqvi
content: Once Mohsin Naqvi took the dais, he was informed that Indian team won't accept the trophy if he tries to force himself and an official protest would be lodged.

title: Haryana police personnel sustain injuries as mob attacks them during raid in Nuh; 13 held
content: Sixteen people named in the FIR and around 50 unidentified people were part of the mob that attacked the police

title: Concern over rise in accidents on newly built NH 66 stretch
content: Two back-to-back accidents in two days on the stretch result in three fatalities; illegal parking of heavy vehicles, especially lorries, poses safety threat to motorists

title: HC constitutes high-level study group to examine sewerage network in Kochi
content: The panel comprises LSGD Principal Secretary, KSPCB Chairperson, KWA chief, and Corporation Secretary; the court has directed the study group to submit a preliminary report within a month outlining the areas that need attention

title: Operation Sindoor on games field, India wins: PM Modi on Asia Cup final
content: PM Modi said on X, "Operation Sindoor on the games field. Outcome is the same - India wins! Congrats to our cricketers."

title: A horrific night reporting a stampede at Karur
content: Initially, the crowd was sparse, leading one to believe that the turnout would be low. However, the numbers swelled around 4 p.m., after Vijay’s rally in Namakkal. The crowd waited patiently as high-energy songs praising him were being played

title: Government raising awareness on early diagnosis for heart conditions, says Minister
content: On the eve of World Heart Day, Satya Kumar Yadav claims that around 1.41 lakh people with heart conditions receive free medical treatment worth around ₹996 crore through the NTR Vaidya Seva

title: RJD, Congress to give up seats in favour of allies in Bihar
content: The RJD-led mahagatbandhan is narrowing down on a seat-sharing formula for the upcoming Bihar Assembly polls, where both RJD and Congress have agreed to give up a dozen seats each to accommodate the now expanded coalition

title: Heavy rush in Vijayawada on eve of Moola Nakshatram day, traffic diversions in place
content: Thousands of devotees throng the city for darshan of Goddess Kanaka Durga, leading to traffic snarls at major junctions. Officials announce diversions and no-vehicle zones, with tight security for the Chief Minister’s visit to Indrakeeladri

title: KVPS slams government for ‘humiliating’ Legislative Council Chairman
content: Moshenu Raju has not been invited to the inauguration of the new Assembly building complex as he belonged to the SC community, the KVPS leaders allege

title: Deepavali discount sale begins at Co-optex showroom in Villupuram
content: According to a press release, Co-optex will offer a rebate of 30% on silk and cotton saris sourced from weavers in Coimbatore, Kancheepuram, Salem, Arani, and Tirubhuvanam, among other places.

title: Krishna floods: Officials close bathing ghats, stop devotees from taking bath in river
content: Villagers evacuated from Pata Yadlalanka island at Avanigadda; those staying in the downstream of Krishna asked not to cross the overflowing canals and the river on countrymade boats

title: The Hindu and Andhra Hospitals to conduct awareness programme today on heart health
content: Aim is to educate people the importance of maintaining a healthy heart through lifestyle choices, timely diagnosis, and preventive care

title: WRD begins restoration of Thalavanur anicut across Thenpennai River
content: Located about 10 km from Villupuram, the anicut had been designed to trap flood waters and help recharge ground water.

title: At UNGA week, India signals realignment with the Global South
content: Troubles with the U.S., a shift on criticising Israel, External Affairs Minister Jaishankar’s meetings on UNGA sidelines indicate focus on developing world

title: BJP leaders to tour flood-hit districts in Karnataka in two teams
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party leaders will tour different flood-hit districts in Karnataka to assess the situation

title: No ceasefire, Maoists must give up arms, says Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister reiterates pledge to eradicate Left-Wing Extremism by March 2026, cites success of unified strategy under Modi government

title: 1,360 members of 445 families shifted from flood-hit villages to care centres in Yadgir
content: Road connectivity to 24 villages in the district has been disrupted after bridges/bridge-cum-barrages got submerged in the Bhima waters

title: Research, innovation, entrepreneurship are thrust areas for Higher Education 2.0, says top NITI Aayog official
content: Mr. Shah said that the contribution of innovation and entrepreneurship has been reflected in the steady rise of start-ups in the country.

title: Death toll in Karur stampede rises to 40; Justice Aruna Jagadeesan begins inquiries
content: Of the 40 dead, 17 were women, 14 men, and nine children. Medical teams completed post-mortems on all victims on September 27 night and began handing over the bodies to their families before dawn on September 28

title: Two civilians killed in Ladakh protests cremated amid curfew in Leh
content: The unrest in Ladakh is the BJP’s own creation. The same people who once cheered abrogation of Article 370  now feel betrayed by unkept promises. Youth anger, joblessness, and denial of Sixth Schedule rights have pushed them to the streets

title: Punjab should be seen as India’s gateway to Eurasia, says Congress’ Bajwa
content: The Opposition leader proposed the creation of an ‘Amritsar-Rajpura economic corridor’ with ‘agro-processing clusters, industrial parks, and logistics hubs powering Punjab’s integration into global supply chains’

title: In stampede cases, police must prove ‘gross’ criminal negligence directly endangered human life, according to court verdicts
content: One of the offences levelled against TVK leaders in a case registered by the Karur Town Police following a stampede at a meeting addressed by actor Vijay is commission of an “act endangering life and personal safety of others”

title: Incessant rain batters Maharashtra; over 11,500 people shifted to relief camps
content: Six villages in Dharashiv cut off; CM Fadnavis terms next two days “critical” as IMD issues red alert for Mumbai, Konkan, and Marathwada

title: LDF backs NSS leadership that is under fire for endorsing government’s Sabarimala policy
content: Transport Minister K.B. Ganesh Kumar slams “scattered protests by a few disgruntled elements” and says Sukumaran Nair has not veered from NSS’s stated principle of political equi-distance

title: SFI slams Andhra Pradesh government’s move to hand over 10 medical colleges to private parties under PPP
content: The SFI leaders warn the move will make medical education unaffordable and healthcare costlier, and accuse State and Central governments of neglecting public education and student welfare

title: Article in Raj Bhavan’s magazine in sharp focus after Kerala CM’s remarks
content: Legal Adviser to the Governor deals with the Supreme Court judgment of April 8 with respect to the Tamil Nadu Governor reserving Bills for the President’s assent

title: Devotees chant ‘Govinda... Govinda’ as Lord Malayappa rides the imperial ‘Garuda Vahanam’
content: Hundreds of devotees stand reverently in their places and offer ‘harati’ in unison to the processional deity adorned in an array of priceless and antique ornaments

title: Clinic opens in Kondapur, to cater to IT Corridor’s healthcare needs
content: For people with busy schedules and for those requiring comprehensive health check-ups, this clinic will be very useful, says Union Minister Kishan Reddy

title: Pilgrim footfalls peak as more than two lakh descend on Tirumala for ‘Garuda Seva’
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams, the Police, the Vigilance and Security teams, and the district administration work in tandem to ensure a safe and comfortable experience for the teeming pilgrims

title: Queer-friendly clinic becomes operational at Ernakulam GH
content: Apart from the queer-friendly clinic, the General Hospital has received several new facilities, including a modern mortuary complex, a stroke ICU, and a renovated cath lab

title: Vigilance raids uncover corruption in forest range offices
content: Operation Vanaraksha undertaken simultaneously in 71 forest range offices across Kerala uncovers evidence of officials collecting over ₹1.07 crore as bribes and kickbacks from contractors

title: Cut off and displaced, flood-hit Kalaburagi waits for waters to recede
content: The deluge stems from massive discharge, over 3.5 lakh cusecs, from Maharashtra’s Sina, Ujjani and Veer reservoirs

title: Karur stampede: A daily-wage worker mourns his baby killed in the tragedy
content: Vishnu, the youngest among the victims, was the only child of Vimal and Matheswari, who is speech- and hearing-impaired. After two years of marriage, the couple had their son. On Sunday (September 28, 2025) morning, they performed his last rites

title: Malarikkal plans to draw more visitors with added attractions, extended timings
content: The Meenachil–Meenanthara–Kodoor river relinking initiative, which hosts the annual water lily festival, is planning to install solar-powered lights at the site. This will allow visitors to admire the pink floral carpet right from midnight, when the flowers begin to bloom.

title: Extreme poverty eradication project in final stage, say officials
content: ‘In Ernakulam, 217 beneficiaries have been identified, of whom 149 have been allotted land; procedures to issue title deeds to remaining 68 are under way’

title: Hearings on disqualification petitions against BRS MLAs from Monday
content: Restrictions imposed on the legislature premises as four MLAs gear up to present their stand  in the first phase

title: Jackson injures hamstring as Ravens fall to 1-3
content: Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson sustained a hamstring injury in the third quarter of his team's 37-20 loss to the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium, and coach John Harbaugh had no update during his postgame media availability.

title: Coen, Saleh clash postgame over sign-stealing talk
content: The simmering tension over 49ers DC Robert Saleh's remark about the Jaguars "legally stealing signals" from opponents spilled onto the field Sunday, as Saleh and Jacksonville coach Liam Coen had to be separated amid a heated postgame exchange.

title: Mercury oust short-handed Lynx, reach Finals
content: Phoenix overcame a 13-point deficit in the final period to beat Minnesota in Game 4 on Sunday night and advance to the WNBA Finals.

title: Furious U.S. rally not enough as Europe wins Cup
content: Europe has won the Ryder Cup, fending off a furious rally from the U.S. in singles play at Bethpage Black. Shane Lowry's birdie putt on No. 18 proved the decisive shot, and Europe went on to win 15-13.

title: Mets fumble final shot at October: 'It's a failure'
content: The Mets, who entered the season with a $322.6 million payroll and huge expectations, completed their monthslong collapse Sunday with a loss to Miami.

title: Kuminga won't appear at media day amid deadline
content: Restricted free agent Jonathan Kuminga did not travel to San Francisco and won't be in attendance for Monday's media day, sources told ESPN.

title: USC's Watkins to miss season following ACL tear
content: USC star JuJu Watkins will miss the 2025-26 college basketball season as she continues to recover from a right ACL tear that she suffered in the NCAA tournament.

title: Bad Bunny to headline Super Bowl halftime show
content: Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny will headline the Apple Music Super Bowl halftime show from Levi's Stadium on Feb. 8 in Santa Clara, California.

title: The only MLB playoff preview you need: World Series odds, likely MVPs and how far all 12 teams will go
content: Have Fall Classic or bust hopes for the postseason? Here's why your squad could be playing deep into October ... or get sent home early.

title: Best, worst of NFL Week 4: Rams end Colts' hot start, plus Chiefs win big over Ravens
content: Our NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 4.

title: Ryder Cup 2025 best moments: Europe wins the Cup
content: Team USA couldn't quite pull off a legendary comeback on Sunday with Europe winning 15-13 to keep the Ryder Cup.

title: 10 moments that define 2025 Mets' epic collapse
content: The Mets nearly won a pennant last year -- and then added Juan Soto. And yet a season of promise turned into an all-time collapse.

title: Oregon in OT? Virginia's stunner? Bama's redemption? Ranking the 25 best games of Week 5﻿﻿
content: The heavyweight battles brought the goods, but there were even more thrillers. We rank Week 5's games.

title: A raucous Week 5 reshuffled expectations
content: With four top-10 teams losing, Week 5 offered a reminder of just how little we know so early in a season.

title: Ranking Week 4 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 4's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Arsenal handle adversity, prove they belong in Premier League title race
content: Arsenal's last-minute 2-1 win over Newcastle United has been yet another demonstration of their Premier League title credentials.

title: Chase Elliott races from eighth to win in two-lap OT at Kansas
content: Chase Elliott drove from eighth to the checkered flag during a two-lap overtime sprint at Kansas Speedway to earn a spot in the third round of NASCAR's playoffs.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Al Horford's deal with Warriors
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What scouts are saying about Drew Allar
content: What is Drew Allar's current draft stock? Which Ohio State prospect stood out the most Saturday? We have updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 5.

title: UFC Perth takeaways: Ulberg's time is now, Crute redemption arc continues
content: What's next for Carlos Ulberg after his statement KO win over Dominick Reyes? Here are the biggest takeaways.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Benzema linked with reunion with Mourinho at Benfica
content: Could we see Karim Benzema reunite with his former Real Madrid manager Jose Mourinho at Benfica? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Liverpool pay tribute to Matt Beard on return to WSL action
content: Liverpool fans celebrated the life of former boss Matt Beard during their WSL loss to Manchester United on Sunday.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Rookie Watch: Demidov and 11 other names you need to know this season
content: Whether in a redraft or dynasty league, here are the rookies you need to know before your fantasy hockey draft.

title: Massive Protests In PoK Today, Thousands Demand For Structural Reforms
content: Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) is bracing for one of its largest protests in recent history, as the Awami Action Committee (AAC) prepares to launch sweeping demonstrations across the region today.

title: Decorated US Marine, Served In Iraq: All About Thomas Sanford, Michigan Church Shooter
content: The man, who crashed his vehicle through the front doors of a Mormon church in Michigan on Sunday and opened fire on the congregation, has been identified by police as a 40-year-old man from the nearby town of Burton.

title: Congress Writes To Amit Shah Over "Chilling Death Threat" To Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress general secretary KC Venugopal on Sunday wrote to Home Minister Amit Shah over a former ABVP leader's controversial remarks targeting Rahul Gandhi during a televised debate.

title: "All On Board For Something Special": Trump Ahead Of Meeting Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to hold a crucial White House meeting with US President Donald Trump on Monday amid assertions from Washington that an ambitious plan to end the war in Gaza is nearly complete.

title: 4 Killed, 8 Injured In Shooting At Mormon Church In Michigan, Police Say Shooter Is Down
content: A gunman opened fire inside a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints chapel in Michigan during a Sunday service and set the building ablaze, killing at least four people and injuring eight others. Police shot and killed the suspect.

title: "Operation Sindoor On Field": PM Modi After India Beat Pak In Asia Cup Final
content: India's ninth Asia Cup title, following a five-wicket win over arch-rivals Pakistan in a thrilling final on Sunday, drew massive cheers from Prime Minister Narendra Modi with a reference to Operation Sindoor.

title: "Witch Hunt Began 4 Years Ago": Sonam Wangchuk's Wife Denies Allegations
content: Social entrepreneur Gitanjali J Angmo, the wife of detained activist Sonam Wangchuk, has refuted all the allegations made by the Centre against her husband after violence left four dead and over 50 injured during his hunger strike.

title: Week After Releasing Elderly British Couple, Taliban Frees US Citizen From Afghanistan Prison
content: Afghanistan's Taliban government announced the release of a detained American citizen on Sunday, a week after an elderly British couple were also released by the authorities.

title: Gautam Adani, Son Visit Zubeen Garg's Home In Guwahati To Pay Homage
content: Leading industrialist Gautam Adani and his son Jeet paid a visit to deceased singer-composer Zubeen Garg's house in Assam's Guwahati on Sunday, and paid homage to the state's cultural icon.

title: Stampede At Actor-Politician Vijay's Rally Described In Haunting Visuals
content: A father, holding his son's lifeless body in his arms, frantically pleading with hospital authorities to save him; a mother lying next to her dead son in a hospital bed are among the several haunting visuals that have emerged from the stampede

title: Middle East Crisis Breakthrough? Trump Says 'Something Special' Will Be Done
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday hinted at a breakthrough in the Middle East crisis, saying "all are on board for something special," on the eve of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit to the White House.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Cut The Politics, We Need Answers On Tamil Nadu Tragedy
content: Velusamypuram will remain a painful memory for Tamil Nadu. The scale of the tragedy that unfolded with the loss of 40 lives, including 10 children and several women, in a political gathering is gruesome, if not unprecedented.

title: Kerala Boy, 12, Crushed By Coconut Tree While Trying To Catch Parrot: Cops
content: A 12-year-old boy died on Sunday after a coconut tree fell on him while he was attempting to catch a parrot near his home here, police said.

title: From IIT To IAS: Who is Rajeev Verma, Delhi's New Top Bureaucrat?
content: Senior IAS officer Rajeev Verma has been appointed as new Chief Secretary of Delhi. A 1992-batch officer of the Arunachal Pradesh-Goa-Mizoram-Union Territory cadre, Rajeev Verma will take charge on October 1, succeeding Dharmendra

title: Positive, Negative And In between: What World Leaders Said About Trump's Policies
content: Regardless of political perspective, no one could argue that the presidency of Donald Trump - and his second term so far in particular - has been anything less than consequential, not only for the United States but for the world.

title: Delhi BJP Gets A New 5-Storey Office. PM Modi To Inaugurate It Monday
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Delhi Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) new headquarters on Deendayal Upadhyay Marg on Monday.

title: Over 300 Delhi Schools, Several Airports Receive Hoax Bomb Threats
content: More than 300 schools and institutes in Delhi and several airports received bomb threats on Sunday morning, which were later declared a hoax, officials said.

title: "Lay Down Your Arms": Amit Shah Rejects Ceasefire Offer From Maoists
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday rejected the ceasefire offer given by Maoists, saying if the extremists want to surrender and lay down arms, they are most welcome to do so and security forces would not fire a single bullet on them.

title: Snapback Sanctions Trigger Confrontation Between Iran And The West
content: Iran's theocracy prepared Sunday for a possible confrontation with the West after the United Nations reimposed sanctions over its nuclear programme, even as some pushed for continued negotiations to ease the economic pain squeezing the country.
